text: hi everyone big thingy gas tano here the
internet's busiest music nerd and it's
time for a review
of the new 21 savage and metro boomin
album
savage mode 2. this is a brand new
collaboration between
atlanta rapper 21 savage and atlanta
producer
metro boomin colliding once again to
follow up one of the most
celebrated trap records of the 2010s
savage mode
now it's no secret i'm not particularly
crazy about that one
though i do get it was pivotal in
establishing 21 and metro as the trap
vets they are today and there was
certainly something to the cold-blooded
skeletal and murderous sounds the album
presented
oh but god was it one dimensional such
a tedious listen even with it only being
just 32 minutes
but honestly it's not something i'm
dwelling on going into this new lp
because artistically
metro and 21 have grown quite a bit
since then proven by
all the worthwhile projects they've
dropped along the way
there's the impeccably eerie without
warning with offset
there's 21 savages i am greater than i
was where he was sounding more versatile
and mature than ever metro's gucci mane
crossover drop top is easily one of
goop's best projects of the 2010s
there were some pretty impressive
moments on not all heroes wear capes too
so basically what i was hoping for going
into this is 21
and metro would take everything they've
gained and put that
into the savage mode experience level it
up
and i think that's what they did
starting with actor morgan freeman
narrating
on multiple tracks here the intro
numerous bumpers in between tracks a
pretty long
interlude where he's detailing the
street code in regards to snitches and
rats
which in concept seems like a ridiculous
or even an odd thing to add to a project
like this
it actually brings an urgency and a
seriousness to a lot of the topics that
21 savage is spitting across this thing
but i gotta say the biggest improvement
that 21 and metro bring
to savage mode 2 is the
versatility to a degree i think they're
pulling out all the stops
we get improved and dynamic versions of
the kind of tracks that
could have made it onto the original
savage mode running
sliding glock in my lap where we get
some really
harrowing strings it's all somehow
darker and more grim
than it was before with lyrical
standouts like y'all be smoking fake ops
we be smoking
facts 21's wrapping comes off more
dimensional on this project too
he is a bit more expressive in his own
way more willing to switch up his flows
here and there he shows off his absurd
sense of humor with outlandish gun talk
like
a dracobite mosquito and all my glocks
got dildos but while these highlights
are here we also get cuts that
would normally seem out of bounds for a
sequel to
savage mode whether that be mr right now
which is a feel
good super catchy sex jam 21's flows and
hook are really infectious on this one
though i will say his semi-monotone
voice
it doesn't exactly convey lust but he
does
come off softer in his own way
occasionally working in a witty bar or
two like
need tlc we can creep if you want the
drake verse on the back end
fits the lighthearted mood of the track
really well too though that weird
scissor bar he got
in hot water for and she had to respond
what a mess then steppen is an amazing
and totally unexpected 80s throwback the
beat on this one seemed
just a little too specific and yeah it's
pretty much the instrumental to nobody
disses me from rodney oh and joe cooley
from the synthhorn lines
to the beat to the chimey tones yeah
it's pretty much the same instrumental
but what a pull and 21 savage really
does his own thing over it while
also effectively illustrating how many
parallels there are between his style
and hip-hop's roots in the 80s sure
while over the years technology has
impacted the sound of the genre
lyrics have gotten more explicit
production aesthetics have shifted the
posturing the braggadocio and the
competitive attitude have maintained for
decades
there's also said and done where 21
savage gets 21 sensitive over a
glistening instrumental that also has an
old school vibe to it it's almost like
an ll cool j
i need love type b lyrically 21 savage
goes further into this story of
cheating heartbreak betrayal a
reiteration of a lot of the narrative
on the previous track rap love but a lot
more compelling
this time around part of me feels like
we could have done without rip love
altogether the basic flows and open
space 21 leaves at numerous points on
this instrumental
just leaves the track feeling hollow and
a little
stiff in this particular moment 21's
very
understated delivery doesn't exactly
complement the drama the lyrics imply
too
though i do admire the topical focus
said and done
also gets deeper into 21's personal
struggle coming up in music
and overall makes for a great send-off
at the end of the record
other highlights on this thing include
many men the eerie synth leads on this
one the
smooth rushes of enveloping bass
21's flows across this track are tighter
than usual and very quite nicely
i appreciate the 50 cent nod toward the
end of the song given the
title then there is snitches and rats
which you can
most likely guess what that's about
putting snitches
and rats in the dirt portraying them as
spineless cowardly
untrustworthy will sell their own mom
and friends and brothers up the river
hilarious simple and to the point hook
on this one that just
works plus that black air force
ones in the field that's my cleats line
and young nudie on this track sounding
more coherent than ever
fantastic 2c 21 crossing over with his
cousin again my dog goes deeper into
21's backstory into the dirt he did
the betrayals feeling haunted by the
friends he lost
and growing up with less than nothing in
a way because he didn't even have
a visa he then goes on to address some
of the teasing he's received over being
born in the uk
which he does and about as gangster away
as possible the instrumental on this one
is full of dramatic pianos
simple trap beat it's not too much but
it's not giving you too little either
the auto-tuned hook on this one is
really tight too that
we pull up with brooms we sweep the room
21's singing on this record while it's
not great
it does provide some really sticky
moments across the track list
for the last leg of this thing we get
tracks like brand new draco
no op left behind both songs that i
think have good
instrumentals strong starts but both of
them
are a little deficient in the hook
department and drag on a little too long
with all of that being said though i
enjoyed this project
quite a bit i think it improved upon the
sound
and the style and the versatility of the
original savage mode
a lot more detail personality dimensions
and variations
things i was just dying for on that
first project and
while yeah there are some tracks i think
i'm a little indifferent toward or
are just sheer duds there's nothing
really here that wouldn't make me
excited to listen to a
savage mode 3. feeling a light too
decent 7
on this one tran position have you given
this album
a listen did you love it did you hate it
what would you rate it you're the best
you're the best what should i review
next hit the like if you like please
subscribe and please don't cry hit the
bell as well
over here next to my head is another
video that you can check out hit that up
or the link to subscribe to the channel
anthony fantano 21 savage metro boomin
savage mode 2
forever
